author: JustinGrote
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce
Place the following in a module:
```powershell

using namespace Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Common.Authentication.Abstractions.Core
#requires -module Az.Accounts,Microsoft.Graph.Authentication
function Connect-MgGraphAz {
    [CmdletBinding()]
    param (
        [Parameter(ValueFromPipeline)][IAzureContextContainer]$DefaultProfile
    )
    Write-Host "TEST!"
}
```
and it will throw `Unable to find type [IAzureContextContainer]` on execution. 

If you change it to a script and dotsource it, it will work fine. 

If you provide the fully qualified name to the parameter, it will work fine. 

If you define the using namespace at the powershell session scope before calling the function, it will work fine.

Non-parameter usage (e.g. in the process block) works fine.

If you call the function from within the scope of the module, it still does not work.
Example:
`& (gmo mymodule) {Connect-mggraphaz}`

Appears to be a scoping issue with using namespace

## Expected behavior

```none
Parameter works with short name if using namespace is defined in the module scope but exposed to the user
```

## Actual behavior

```none
Throws error `Unable to find type [IAzureContextContainer]`
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Related: #13768
Interestingly, it does seem to work with _some_ namespaces, such as `System.Collection.Generic`.

title: using namespace prefix ignored for module function parameters
